The Master Web package (`@mbc-cqrs-serve: The Master Web package (`@mbc-cqrs-serverless/master-web`) provides a complete set of React components for managing master data and settings. It integrates seamlessly with the backend Master Service and includes pre-built pages, forms, and data tables.

When using master-web components with Ne: When using master-web components with Next.js App Router (v14+/v15), there are important considerations for handling Server-Side Rendering (SSR) and client-side state.
The JsonEditor component uses the `jsone: The JsonEditor component uses the `jsoneditor` library internally, which requires browser APIs (`self`, `window`) that are not available during SSR. This causes errors like:
Solution: Dynamic Import with SSR Disabl: Solution: Dynamic Import with SSR Disabled
Use Next.js dynamic imports with `ssr: f: Use Next.js dynamic imports with `ssr: false` to load master-web components only on the client side:
Create wrapper component that handles dy: Create wrapper component that handles dynamic import
Dynamic import inside component for prop: Dynamic import inside component for proper context handling
Define the dynamic import inside a wrapp: Define the dynamic import inside a wrapper component (using `useMemo`) rather than at the module level. This ensures the AppProviders context is properly available when the component mounts.
**The most recommended implementation pa: **The most recommended implementation pattern** is to use Next.js App Router's `layout.tsx` to set up AppProviders. This pattern reliably avoids the `httpClient.get is not a function` error.
**Solves React Context Isolation Issues*: **Solves React Context Isolation Issues**: React Context bundled in npm packages can become isolated from the application's context. By setting up providers in the Layout, the Context is guaranteed to be initialized before child components mount.
**Synchronous httpClient Initialization*: **Synchronous httpClient Initialization**: By using `useMemo`, the httpClient is created synchronously without async state management (useState + useEffect).
**Automatic Auth Token Injection**: Usin: **Automatic Auth Token Injection**: Using Axios interceptors, the latest auth token is automatically retrieved for each request.
Create URL provider synchronously with u: Create URL provider synchronously with useMemo
Create httpClient synchronously with use: Create httpClient synchronously with useMemo (interceptor auto-injects auth token)
After setting up providers in the Layout: After setting up providers in the Layout, each page component becomes simple:
**layout.tsx**: Set up AppProviders, htt: **layout.tsx**: Set up AppProviders, httpClient, and urlProvider
**page.tsx**: Simply render components w: **page.tsx**: Simply render components with dynamic imports
**MsLayout**: Provides loading overlay a: **MsLayout**: Provides loading overlay and toast notifications
The default httpClient in master-web use: The default httpClient in master-web uses AWS Amplify v5 APIs (`Auth.currentSession()`). If your project uses AWS Amplify v6, you must provide a custom httpClient.
The Layout-based Provider Pattern exampl: The Layout-based Provider Pattern example above uses Amplify v6's `fetchAuthSession` with Axios interceptors. This is the recommended approach.
Alternative Pattern: Configuration in Pa: Alternative Pattern: Configuration in Page Component
Alternative implementation if you don't: Alternative implementation if you don't use the Layout pattern:

httpClient is initialized asynchronously: httpClient is initialized asynchronously and not ready when the component mounts

If URLs are generated incorrectly (e.g.,: If URLs are generated incorrectly (e.g., `//admin/...` instead of `/admin/...`), check the BaseUrlProvider configuration:
When implementing the `IUrlProvider` int: When implementing the `IUrlProvider` interface directly without extending `BaseUrlProvider`, you need to explicitly define all URL properties. See the Layout-based Provider Pattern example above for reference.
**This is the recommended way to integra: **This is the recommended way to integrate master-web with Next.js App Router.** Following this pattern will help you avoid common issues like `httpClient.get is not a function` errors.
When using this library with Next.js App: When using this library with Next.js App Router (v14+/v15), use the **Layout-based Provider Pattern**. Set up `AppProviders` in a `layout.tsx` file, and use dynamic imports for components in `page.tsx` files.
Create a layout file that sets up the pr: Create a layout file that sets up the providers. This ensures the context is properly initialized before child components mount.

React Context in npm packages can become: React Context in npm packages can become isolated. Layout ensures context is initialized first.

Axios interceptors inject the latest aut: Axios interceptors inject the latest auth token on every request.
Pages only need dynamic imports and comp: Pages only need dynamic imports and component rendering.
